intro: Geoprumnon mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican geoprumnon, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its vibrant floral display.
